snippet: Donated blood and blood components should be screened by blood banks for contamination with the virus, the Food and Drug Administration said....
abstract: Food and Drug Administration recommends all blood banks screen donations for Zika virus infection, even in places where there have been no reports of infection; experts say recommendation could be difficult to adhere to for some blood banks and third-party labs.
lead_paragraph: Donated blood and blood components should be screened by blood banks for contamination with the virus, the Food and Drug Administration said.

headline.main: All Donated Blood in U.S. Should Be Tested for Zika, F.D.A. Says
